page.title: 17Hemingstone People's Views
page.content: Due to the National County Structure Plan, only very limited development is permitted in certain villages such as Hemingstone and many local people there feel development on a very small scale would be most welcome to keep the village viable. To try to keep the community spirit in spite of a dwindling population, Hemingstone started a "Meet your Neighbour" scheme in 1985. Once a month for one afternoon, villagers are welcome to meet in Hemingstone Hut to chat over a cup of tea. Also during the summer 3 or 4 Saturday morning markets are held in the Hut to raise money for Church funds. Homemade cakes, homegrown produce etc. is on sale. Newcomers to the area find people very friendly and helpful and in the most part feel protected from the pressures of less attractive aspects of town life.
